intro: Kokia cookei, commonly known as the Cook's kokia, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and unique, branching structure. The plant typically grows in rocky, coastal areas and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Kokia cookei is critically endangered due to habitat loss and invasive species, making it a focus of conservation efforts. Its limited distribution and ecological significance highlight the importance of preserving such rare botanical species.
